If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.95-1 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-2697/folder/13177029/41237846/1110522784 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** applausetester+sjdiosn2djois2j2d@applause.expensifail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Exploratory - Significant User Experience Deterioration **Device used:** Mac 26.1 / Chrome **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: 1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. [User A] Submit an expense to User B. 3. [User B] Open the IOU report. 4. [User B] Click Mark as paid. ## Expected Result: "marked as paid" message will show the actor after paying IOU report. ## Actual Result: "marked as paid" message is missing actor after paying IOU report. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1e2f245f-c324-4e51-a0cf-99dbc6271615 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

title: [CFI] Conditionally add billable & reimbursable columns to the reports view

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: NewFeature
labels.description: Something to build that is a new item.

body:
## Conditionally add billable & reimbursable columns to the reports view

Coming from https://expensify.slack.com/archives/CAS1DND4H/p1767718496897769

We would like to add support for viewing if a report's transactions are billable or reimbursable in the expense report view. We will add the following columns to the report, based on the following conditions:

- If billable is enabled on the workspace, show the Billable column in the report view. This column will show either **Yes** or **No** as its value.
- If there are any non-reimbursable expenses on the report, show the Reimbursable column in the report view. This column will show either **Yes** or **No** as its value.

<details><summary>Issue Owner</summary>Current Issue Owner: @</details>

title: [$125] `verifySignedCommits` doesn't paginate commits and can thus miss unsigned commits

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Improvement
labels.description: Item broken or needs improvement.

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
### Problem The [`verifySignedCommits`](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/65e7b60b533741f2/.github/actions/javascript/verifySignedCommits/verifySignedCommits.ts) workflow doesn't paginate commits, so if a PR has more than 30 commits ([default value](https://docs.github.com/en/rest/commits/commits?apiVersion=2022-11-28#list-commits) for `per_page`), it doesn't properly detect unsigned commits after the 30th. ### Repro steps 1. Create a fresh branch 2. Create 30 signed commits, then an unsigned one (this assumes your git config already has signature enabled by default) ```zsh # Create 30 signed commits on a new branch for i in {1..30}; do git commit --allow-empty -m "Test commit $i" done # Create an unsigned commit git commit --no-gpg-sign --allow-empty -m "Unsigned commit test" ``` 4. Run the `verifySignedCommits` workflow 5. Notice that it passes [Example PR](https://github.com/Expensify/App-Test-Fork/pull/138) – [workflow passes](https://github.com/Expensify/App-Test-Fork/actions/runs/20764747441/job/59628267122) despite unsigned 31st commit ### Solution Use octokit's pagination functionality to get all commits on the PR.

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** v9.2.94-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/folder/13177080/test-cases/41237956 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** agexptest+pr060126@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Exploratory - Significant User Experience Deterioration **Device used:** iPhone 13 Mini/ iOS 26.1 **App Component:** Workspace Settings ## Action Performed: 1. Launch the Expensify app 2. Go to Workspaces 3. Tap a workspace row first, then quickly open the 3‑dots menu next to the workspace name ## Expected Result: Only the workspace settings page opens. ## Actual Result: The workspace settings page and the 3-dot menu appear simultaneously. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8511c8ac-21f4-4995-bfff-1abb0e3f3656 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)
